channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Series of Dropped service drains, 8th January
item.description:
The dropped service drains along Station Road (between Huntsmans Meet and Waterside Close) continue to cause issues for residents on either side of the road with vibrations shaking properties when the larger vehicles (service buses) go over the drains. Motorists are also mentioning issues now, with several holes appearing on the drains.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Andoversford, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
This pot hole is right is difficult to see or avoid because of its location just past the traffic calming build out.

item.title: The drain is blocked problem, 8th January
item.description:
Drainage soakaway needs digging out under pavement or changing to channel in pavement . do i need permission Thank You John Rowland 01242 255414
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street Light Outage Opposite to 2 Cromwell Road, Innsworth, GL3 1FG, 8th January
item.description:
I am writing to report that the street light opposite my property at 2 Cromwell Road, Innsworth, Gloucester, GL3 1FG has been out of order for the past two months. This outage has created significant safety concerns during the evening and night, as the footpath and road are completely dark. The lack of lighting increases the risk of accidents, particularly slips caused by black ice, which is difficult to detect in the dark. Could you please arrange for this street light to be repaired as soon as possible? If you require any additional details, I am happy to provide them.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cromwell Road, Innsworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Light sensor is not detecting vehicles problem, 8th January
item.description:
Customer reports that residents are unhappy about the temporary 3-way TS at the location, which are in place for a delivery. Ostensibly, there is nothing going on and road users feel they should be removed, if this indeed the case, to free up the road for traffic. Please can they be updated asap.
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Light sensor is not detecting vehicles

item.title: Do NOT fell tree please, 8th January
item.description:
Locals have said the conifer on Church Road, Churchdown is not safe. But it appears safe and has high amenity value, being very visible and enhances the street scene. Please do NOT fell! It is privately owned.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Church Road, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Temp lights by Hare & Hounds junction, 8th January
item.description:
The timings of these temp lights need to be looked at ASAP! Going towards Churchdown traffic is unable to go on green due to opposite traffic Going towards Innsworth being on red at Hare and Hounds lights. This is causing major issues in the mornings and 3pm onwards. You need to sort - thanks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 7, Parton Road, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Light sensor is not detecting vehicles

item.title: VAS Not Working Correctly, 8th January
item.description:
Since the flag has been added to the lamp post, the VAS vehicle activated speed indicator is no longer clearly visible to approaching drivers, which undermines its purpose. Please can this be investigated ASAP with the relevant team so flag is removed and any damage to the VAS repaired so the sign is made fully visible again.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Two Hedges Road, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Sign isn't working correctly (part only or random activation)
